creator: ahmad.abed@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 30424
crash log

Tomcat using tcnative-1.dll with OCSP support crashed and generate java core dump when OCSP server is not reachable
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tested on Tomcat 7.0.37 with JDK 7.0.21 and JDK 6.0.30 on WIN2003( 32bit )  and WIN7 ( 64bit )
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Attached core dump log
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Following Error Reported :

#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x65195e30, pid=3224, tid=1256
#
# JRE version: 7.0_21-b11
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (23.21-b01 mixed mode windows-x86 )
# Problematic frame:
# C  [tcnative-1.dll+0x5e30]  Java_org_apache_tomcat_jni_Socket_timeoutSet+0x30
#
# Core dump written. Default location: C:\TC7\bin\hs_err_pid3224.mdmp
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# C:\TC7\bin\hs_err_pid3224.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://bugreport.sun.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
# The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.
# See problematic frame for where to report the bug.
#

creator: raviswt@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 33912
Crash_Log_06_06_2016

Hi,

We have ran into similar crash and stack trace. Attaching the log.

Can someone please update the status of this defect?

Regards,
Ravi

Nothing in these crash logs suggests to me that OCSP is involved.

These crashes look to be with fairly old versions of Tomcat and the native library. Please update to the latest release for each and re-open (with the steps to reproduce) if the problem still occurs.
creator: markt@apache.org
